DataElement.preferredName: Follow-up Recurrence Death Malignant Neoplasm Recurrence Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Code for the type of first recurrence after a period of documented disease free intermission or remission.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Follow-up Recurrence Death Malignant Neoplasm Recurrence Number
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The type of first recurrence after a period of documented disease free intermission or remission.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.:To occur again.:The absence of life or state of being dead.

Concepts.definition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

Property.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:To occur again.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A term for diseases in which abnormal cells divide without control. Cancer cells can invade nearby tissues and can spread through the bloodstream and lymphatic system to other parts of the body._To occur again._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: It is unknown whether the disease has recurred or if the patient was ever disease-free.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: It is unknown whether the disease has recurred or if the patient was ever disease-free.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: It is unknown whether the disease has recurred or if the patient was ever disease-free.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Disease has recurred, but the type of recurrence is unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Disease has recurred, but the type of recurrence is unknown.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Disease has recurred, but the type of recurrence is unknown.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Since diagnosis, patient has never been disease-free.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Since diagnosis, patient has never been disease-free.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Since diagnosis, patient has never been disease-free. This includes cases with distant metastasis at diagnosis, systemic disease, unknown primary, or minimal disease that is not treated.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in multiple sites (recurrences that can be coded to more than one category 51-59).

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in multiple sites (recurrences that can be coded to more than one category 51-59).
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in multiple sites (recurrences that can be coded to more than one category 51-59).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in a single distant site (51-58) and local, trocar, and/or regional recurrence (10-15, 20-25, or 30).

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in a single distant site (51-58) and local, trocar, and/or regional recurrence (10-15, 20-25, or 30).
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in a single distant site (51-58) and local, trocar, and/or regional recurrence (10-15, 20-25, or 30).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Distant systemic recurrence of an invasive tumor only.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Distant systemic recurrence of an invasive tumor only.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
Distant systemic recurrence of an invasive tumor only. This includes leukemia, bone marrow
metastasis, carcinomatosis, and generalized disease.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in lymph node only.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in lymph node only.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in lymph node only. Refer to the staging scheme for a description of lymph nodes that are distant for a particular site.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in the skin only.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in the skin only.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in the skin only. This includes skin other than the primary site.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in the CNS only.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in the CNS only.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in the CNS only. This includes the brain and spinal cord, but not the external eye.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in bone only.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in bone only.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in bone only. This includes bones other than the primary site.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in the liver only.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in the liver only.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in the liver only.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in the pleura only.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in the pleura only.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in the pleura only. Pleura includes the pleural surface of all structures within the thoracic cavity and/or positive pleural fluid.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in the lung only. Lung includes the visceral pleura.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in the lung only. Lung includes the visceral pleura.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in the lung only. Lung includes the visceral pleura.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in the peritoneum only.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in the peritoneum only.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Distant recurrence of an invasive tumor in the peritoneum only. Peritoneum includes peritoneal surfaces of all structures within the abdominal cavity and/or positive ascitic fluid.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Distant recurrence of an in situ tumor.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Distant recurrence of an in situ tumor.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Distant recurrence of an in situ tumor.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Distant recurrence and there is insufficient information available to code to 46-62.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Distant recurrence and there is insufficient information available to code to 46-62.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Distant recurrence and there is insufficient information available to code to 46-62.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Both regional recurrence of an in situ tumor in adjacent tissue or organ(s) and/or regional lymph nodes (26 or 27) and local and/or trocar recurrence (16 or 17).

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Both regional recurrence of an in situ tumor in adjacent tissue or organ(s) and/or regional lymph nodes (26 or 27) and local and/or trocar recurrence (16 or 17).
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Both regional recurrence of an in situ tumor in adjacent tissue or organ(s) and/or regional lymph nodes (26 or 27) and local and/or trocar recurrence (16 or 17).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Both regional recurrence of an invasive tumor in adjacent tissue or organ(s) and/or regional lymph nodes (20-25) and local and/or trocar recurrence (10, 13, 14, or 15).

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Both regional recurrence of an invasive tumor in adjacent tissue or organ(s) and/or regional lymph nodes (20-25) and local and/or trocar recurrence (10, 13, 14, or 15).
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Both regional recurrence of an invasive tumor in adjacent tissue or organ(s) and/or regional lymph nodes (20-25) and local and/or trocar recurrence (10, 13, 14, or 15).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Recurrence of an in situ tumor in adjacent tissue or organ(s) and in regional lymph nodes at the same time.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Recurrence of an in situ tumor in adjacent tissue or organ(s) and in regional lymph nodes at the same time.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Recurrence of an in situ tumor in adjacent tissue or organ(s) and in regional lymph nodes at the same time.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Regional recurrence of an in situ tumor, NOS.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Regional recurrence of an in situ tumor, NOS.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Regional recurrence of an in situ tumor, NOS.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Recurrence of an invasive tumor in adjacent tissue or organ(s)) and in regional lymph nodes (both 21 and 22) at the same time.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Recurrence of an invasive tumor in adjacent tissue or organ(s)) and in regional lymph nodes (both 21 and 22) at the same time.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Recurrence of an invasive tumor in adjacent tissue or organ(s)) and in regional lymph nodes (both 21 and 22) at the same time.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Recurrence of an invasive tumor in regional lymph nodes only.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Recurrence of an invasive tumor in regional lymph nodes only.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Recurrence of an invasive tumor in regional lymph nodes only.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Recurrence of an invasive tumor in adjacent tissue or organ(s) only.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Recurrence of an invasive tumor in adjacent tissue or organ(s) only.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Recurrence of an invasive tumor in adjacent tissue or organ(s) only.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Regional recurrence, and there is insufficient information available to code to 21-27.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Regional recurrence, and there is insufficient information available to code to 21-27.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Regional recurrence, and there is insufficient information available to code to 21-27.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Both local and trocar recurrence of an in situ tumor.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Both local and trocar recurrence of an in situ tumor.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Both local and trocar recurrence of an in situ tumor.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Local recurrence of an in situ tumor.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Local recurrence of an in situ tumor.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Local recurrence of an in situ tumor.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Both local and trocar recurrence of an invasive tumor (both 13 and 14)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Both local and trocar recurrence of an invasive tumor (both 13 and 14)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Both local and trocar recurrence of an invasive tumor (both 13 and 14)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Trocar recurrence of an invasive tumor.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Trocar recurrence of an invasive tumor.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Trocar recurrence of an invasive tumor. Includes recurrence in the trocar path or entrance site following prior surgery.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Local recurrence of an invasive tumor.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Local recurrence of an invasive tumor.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Local recurrence of an invasive tumor.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Local recurrence and there is insufficient information available to code to 13-17.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Local recurrence and there is insufficient information available to code to 13-17.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Local recurrence and there is insufficient information available to code to 13-17. Recurrence is confined to the remnant of the organ of origin; to the organ of origin; to the anastomosis; or to scar tissue where the organ previously existed.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: In situ recurrence of an in situ tumor.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: In situ recurrence of an in situ tumor.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: In situ recurrence of an in situ tumor.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: In situ recurrence of an invasive tumor.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: In situ recurrence of an invasive tumor.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: In situ recurrence of an invasive tumor.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No recurrence

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No recurrence
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Patient became disease-free after treatment and has not had a recurrence; leukemia's that are in remission.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:To occur again.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
